Namespace: units

dc. units

Source:
  • core.js, line 313

Namespaces

fp

Methods

<static> integers(start, end)

The default value for .xUnits for the
Coordinate Grid Chart and should
be used when the x values are a sequence of integers.
It is a function that counts the number of integers in the range supplied in its start and end parameters.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
start Number
end Number
Source:
  • core.js, line 320
See:
  • coordinateGridMixin.xUnits
Returns:
Type
Number
Example
chart.xUnits(dc.units.integers) // already the default

<static> ordinal(start, end, domain)

This argument can be passed to the .xUnits function of the to
specify ordinal units for the x axis. Usually this parameter is used in combination with passing
d3.scale.ordinal to
.x.
It just returns the domain passed to it, which for ordinal charts is an array of all values.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
start *
end *
domain Array.<String>
Source:
  • core.js, line 338
See:
  • d3.scale.ordinal
  • coordinateGridMixin.xUnits
  • coordinateGridMixin.x
Returns:
Type
Array.<String>
Example
chart.xUnits(dc.units.ordinal)
     .x(d3.scale.ordinal())
